alert.note: Alert for Perry; Schuylkill; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 12:39AM EST until February 04 at 2:39PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Adams, Cumberland, Dauphin, Franklin, Lancaster, Lebanon, Perry, Schuylkill and York. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ice movement may lead to jams and blockages which hold water back like a dam, flooding upstream of the blockage. The ice jams may also release the pent up water suddenly, causing flooding downstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 AM EST, gauge reports indicated an ice jam and heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lancaster, Harrisburg, York, Lebanon, Chambersburg, Carlisle, Lower Allen, Hanover, Pottsville, Hershey, Ephrata, Weigelstown, Elizabethtown, Waynesboro, Columbia, Lititz, Mechanicsburg, Middletown, Millersville and Camp Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
